meanings.sent1: I am preordering the new book online.
meanings.sent2: Customers often enjoy preordering limited edition items.
meanings.sent3: She joked that she was preordering her lunch for next week.
meanings.sent4: His habit of preordering everything made him seem like a time traveler.
meanings.sent5: The idea of preordering groceries seemed strange at first, but now it's convenient.

meanings.definition: Reserve (an item) for purchase before it is released.
meanings.sent1: We are preordering the concert tickets to secure our seats.
meanings.sent2: Many gamers prefer preordering video games to get exclusive bonuses.
meanings.sent3: The group decided to preordering the movie tickets as a surprise for their friend.
meanings.sent4: Preordering the latest fashion collection felt like owning a piece of the future.
meanings.sent5: She couldn't resist preordering the new phone after seeing its features.
